text:
Raskolnikov sat in dread. 

Nikolay’s confession haunted him. 

It felt inexplicable, amazing. 

But it was a fact. 

“It's only a matter of time,” he thought. 

The danger loomed closer.

He recalled his meeting with Porfiry. 

A shiver ran down his spine. 

“What does he know?” 

Porfiry’s smile had been too knowing. 

Raskolnikov felt exposed, vulnerable. 

“Am I mistaken?” he wondered. 

Porfiry had shown his hand. 

But what if he held more? 

Raskolnikov’s heart raced. 

“Was I too careless?” 

The walls closed in. 

He needed to act. 

Time was slipping away.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov grapples with the implications of Nikolay's confession and the psychological game being played by Porfiry, realizing the danger of his own compromised position.
